entries: When you make a successful attack with a rebounding weapon, your next attack with it before the end of your next turn has advantage if it is made against a different target.

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

item.name: Night Visor
entries: A night visor appears to be a belt-like ring of black metal, a bit over one inch wide and with a diameter of about two feet. A warforged can attune to the night visor, at which point it is placed around its head, covering its eyes. The night visor shrinks to fit the warforged once attuned. While the night visor is attached, it cannot be removed against the warforged's will. A warforged attuned to a night visor has darkvision to a range of 60 ft.

item.name: Taşınabilir Zuhur Kuşağı Üreteci
entries: A portable manifest zone generator is a spherical construct that can levitate when its command word is spoken and be pushed to move around while it's hovering. It has a diameter of 4 feet and it looks magichanical.
It is powered by 4 dragonshards; one of each plus another syberis dragonshard. The dragonshards are consumed upon use and the energy they provide lasts for 1 minute.
It can be activated with a command word to generate a manifest zone to a choosen plane. Couterminous effects of the choosen plane will manifest.

While a manifest zone is active, it's also easier to cast {{@spell planeshift|XPHB}} targeting the choosen plane. While within 30 feet of the device, the spell can be cast using a 5th-level spell slot and the material requirement is automatically satisfied.
The construct has an HP of 32, an AC of 10, and a damage treshold of 1.

item.name: Tactical Armor
entries: This leather composite armor from old era reduces damage taken by 5 and grants advantage on all saving throws.

item.name: Glaive of Kalok Shash
item.reqAttune: by a believer of Kalok Shash
entries: A glaive blessed by Kalok Shash.
This weapon has +1 to attack and damage rolls.
It also deals additional ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage if the target is evil.

item.name: Olladra's Chalice
entries: Any liquid placed into this golden chalice is purified as if by a purify food and drink spell.

A priest of the Sovereign Host can also pour a flask's worth of water into the chalice and, as an action, change it into holy water. Once the chalice has been used twice in this way, it cannot be used until the next dawn.

item.name: Glamoured Breastplate
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

item.name: Amulet of Undead Eyes
entries: This amulet has a small compartment set into its back. When you place a sliver of bone from an undead creature under your control into the compartment, you gain a heightened connection to that undead creature. As a bonus action, you may issue a command to the creature as if it could hear you, regardless of the distance between you, as long as you are on the same plane.

Additionally, as an action, you can see through the creature's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the creature has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

item.name: Talaen Kara
item.reqAttune: by an elf, half-elf, or character proficient in animal handling
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

Loyal steed. Talaen Kara's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2 when it is used from horseback. A horse being ridden by its wielder gains a +2 bonus to armor class. It can cast {@spell beast bond|XGE} on behalf of its wielder, but will only do so with a horse. It can also cast {@spell bless} with its wielder and (if applicable) mount as targets. It will maintain concentration on these spells so that its wielder does not need to do so. Once it casts one of these spell it cannot cast that spell again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Talaen Kara is a chaotic good sentient weapon with an Intelligence of 10, Wisdom of 12, and Charisma of 12. It has hearing and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet.

This beautiful weapon holds the essence of a proud Valenar warhorse, the lifelong companion of the ranger Valea Ildallia. When her faithful steed fi nally fell in battle, Valea forged this blade so her companion could continue to ride with her into battle. While the weapon is intelligent, it has the mind of a horse and only communicates with strong, pure emotions—anger, joy, suspicion, and so on.
Talaen Kara understands Elvish, but does not speak. It communicates empathically by transmitting strong, pure emotions. While intelligent, it has the mind and personality of a horse.

item.name: Rapier
entries: The tangat is a weapon used by the halflings of the Talenta Plains. It is a peculiarly balanced scimitar with a slightly extended, curved haft that allows it to be wielded with blinding speed – even two-handed – by a trained user.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Final Messenger
entries: If Saber is disabled, destroyed, or rendered {@condition unconscious}, his fnal messenger fies off to a message station where a message will be relayed to the Lord of Blades. The fnal messenger is a delicate winged assembly that deploys from his chest and carries a vision of his last moments. It has armor class 20, 10 hit points, and a fy speed of 60 ft.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warforged makes two longsword attacks or a longsword attack and an iron fsts attack.

action.name: Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Iron fists
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flaming Bolts
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Rage
entries: When Cutter is reduced to under 30 hit points, she fies into a rage at the start of her next turn. While in a rage, her Battleaxe attacks do 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. The rage lasts for 3 rounds.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: Cutter has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Final Messenger

The fnal messenger is a delicate winged assembly that deploys from Cutter's chest and carries a vision of her last moments to Saber. It has armor class 20, 10 hit points, and a fy speed of 60 ft.

action.name: Sling

action.name: Morningstar

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When Eranna roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, she can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Halfings have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Halfing Nimbleness
entries: Halfings can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than theirs.

trait.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: Halfings can attempt to hide even when obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Elaydren is a 3rd level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (Spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following sorcerer spells:

trait.name: Artisan's Intuition
entries: When Elaydren makes an ability check with artisan's tools, roll {@dice 1d4} and add it to the result.

trait.name: Maker's Gift
entries: Elaydren knows the cantrip mending.

trait.name: Magecraft
entries: Elaydren can create a temporary magic item out of common materials. Choose a cantrip from the wizard spell list. Describe the item connected to it. As long as she possesses the item, she knows that cantrip. At the end of a long rest, she can replace it with a new item and select a new cantrip from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is her spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

trait.name: Spellsmith
entries: Elaydren can spend one minute to weave a temporary enchantment into a nonmagical suit of armor or weapon. For the next hour the object becomes a magic item, gaining a +1 bonus to AC if it is armor or a +1 bonus to hit and damage if it is a weapon. Once she uses this trait, she can't use it again until she fnishes a long rest.

trait.name: Potion of Greater Healing (Single use)
entries: Elaydren regains {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points.

trait.name: Magecrafted Bracelet
entries: As long as Elaydren wears her silver bracelet set with onyx and pearls, she knows the cantrip minor illusion.

action.name: Dagger +1 (spellsmith)

It has armor class 20, 10 hit points, and a fly speed of 60 ft.

trait.name: Shifting

action.name: Bite (only when shifted)

action.name: Bite

trait.name: Protection
entries: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Pistol

action.name: Club

trait.name: Action Surge (1/day)

trait.name: Indomitable (1/day)
entries: Şol can reroll a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Brutish Durability
entries: Şol adds {@dice 1d6} to his saving throw rolls.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: {@item Glaive of Kalok Shash|Canberron}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d10 + 1d6 + 6}) slahing damage. If the target is evil, it takes additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: {@item Glaive of Kalok Shash|Canberron} (Opposite End)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d4 + 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is evil, it takes additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/day)
entries: Şol gains 18 ({@dice 1d10 + 12}) hit points.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: Şol can move up to his movement speed toward a hostile creature he can see or hear. Şol must end this move closer to the enemy than he started.

bonus.name: Tunnel Fighter
entries: As a bonus aciton, Şol can enter a defensive stance that lasts until the start of his next turn. While in his defensive stance, he can make opportunity attacks without using his reaction, and he can use his reaction to make a melee attack against a creature that moves more than 5 feet while within his reach.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Şol's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 14}). Şol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monster.name: Calderus
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 80 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn’t caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: C-14 Pilot
entries: Calderus has proficiency with all vehicles. While she's using air cehicles, she makes all vehicle handling checks with advantage.

trait.name: Tactical Armor
entries: Calderus is wearing her {@item tactical armor|Canberron}.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 17 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 21}).

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn|MM} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 4d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of bats||bats}, provided that the sun isn't up. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The vampire makes one attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Thuranne can deal an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage to one creature she hits with an attack if she has advantage on the attack roll. She doesn't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and she doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When Thuranne is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

action.name: Multiattack

bonus.name: Insightful Fighting
entries: Thuranne makes a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature she can see that isn't incapacitated, contested by the target's Charisma (Deception) check. If she succeeds, she can use her Sneak Attack against that target even if she doesn't have advantage on the attack roll, but not if she has disadvantage on it.
This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until she successfully uses this feature against a different target.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Thuranne takes take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Hide|XPHB} action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge

entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 2} to hit (the attack roll is made with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Burning Hands (2nd-Level Spell; Innate Spell 1/day)
entries: A thin sheet of flames shoots forth from the ward's aberrant mark. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Khyber's Grace
entries: The AC of the Son of Khyber includes his Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Son of Khyber fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Warrior's Mark
entries: The Son of Khyber deals an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage when he hits with a melee attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Son of Khyber wears +2 leather armor and a cloak of the mountebank (which lets him cast {@spell dimension door} as an action once between every dawn). He also wields a +1 longsword.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Son of Khyber makes three attacks, choosing between his +1 longsword or his mark lash for each attack.

action.name: +1 Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage.

action.name: Mark Lash
entries: {@atk ms} automatically hits, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage.

action.name: Ultimate Binding (1/Day)
entries: The Son of Khyber uses the full power of his mark on one creature he can see within 30 feet. The target creature must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. A creature that currently has 50 or more hit points automatically succeeds on the saving throw. If the target fails the save, it disappears completely, and is bound extradimensionally inside the aberrant mark, where it is {@condition paralyzed}, does not age, and doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

No mortal magic, not even wish, can free a bound creature while the Son of Khyber lives. There is no limit to the number of creatures he can bind. If the Son of Khyber is slain, and {@spell dispel magic} is cast at 9th level on his corpse, all bound creatures are freed, appearing within unoccupied spaces anywhere within {@dice 10d10} feet of his corpse.

bonus.name: Siphon Essence
entries: The Son of Khyber draws power or knowledge from one creature bound inside his mark. He can do so once for each creature bound inside the mark, and regains the ability to draw from each creature again when he finishes a short or long rest. When he does so, the Son of Khyber may either gain access to a specific memory of the bound creature, gaining its knowledge about a specific event, or he may draw on its might or expertise to roll a {@dice d12} and add the result to his next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check before the end of his next turn.

reaction.name: Devour Destiny
entries: Whenever a creature within 30 feet of the Son of Khyber uses Inspiration, a Luck point, or benefits from advantage on a die roll, the Son of Khyber denies the creature any benefit from any resource it spent, and cancels the advantage they might have had on the roll. The Son of Khyber then gains advantage on the next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check he makes before the end of his next turn.

legendary.name: Lash
entries: The Son of Khyber makes an attack with his mark lash.

legendary.name: Expert Footwork
entries: The Son of Khyber moves up to 15 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Consume (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Son of Khyber uses Ultimate Binding if it is available.

trait.name: Expert Ambusher
entries: Ek has advantage on initiative checks and on attack rolls against any creature that is surprised or that hasn't acted in the first round of combat.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Ek deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of one of Ek's allies that isn't incapacitated and Ek doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Ek wears glamoured leather armor (the appearance of which it can change as a bonus action, retaining its protective qualities) and a {@item ring of protection}. It carries a concealed +1 shortsword inside a +1 sword cane.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ek makes two melee attacks. If it has both its +1 shortsword and +1 sword cane drawn, it can make three melee attacks, two with one weapon, and one with the other.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: +1 Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Sword Cane
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: Ek magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, Ek can continue reading its thoughts, as long as Ek's {@status concentration} isn't broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While reading the target's mind, Ek has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: Ek transforms into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Slam

action.name: Read Thoughts

While reading the target's mind, the Tyrant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

action.name: Invoke Duplicity (Recharge on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant can channel the Traveler to create an illusion of itself that lasts for 1 minute, or until it loses its {@status concentration}. The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that it can see within 30 feet. As a bonus action on subsequent turns, the Tyrant can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space it can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of the Tyrant.

For the duration, the Tyrant can cast spells as though it were in the illusion's space, but it must use its own senses. Additionally, when both the Tyrant and its illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, the Tyrant has advantage on attack rolls against that creature.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The Tyrant transforms into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. Additionally, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the countermage's next turn.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges 5-6)
entries: Khandan takes an extra action on his turn.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Khandan has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Khandan fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Khandan wields a magical +2 maul and wears a crimson winged {@item cloak of protection} that gives him a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 hour a day. He has also imbibed three potions, each giving him resistance to one type of damage, and carries two potions of superior healing for use in emergencies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Khandan makes four attacks with his maul. He may forgo one weapon attack to drink a potion.

action.name: +2 Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Potion of Superior Healing (Consumable Item; Carries 2)
entries: Khandan drinks the potion and regains 28 ({@dice 8d4 + 8}) hit points.

bonus.name: Relentless Fortitude (Recharges 5-6)
entries: Khandan regains 20 hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Meira fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Meira wields a +1 frostaxe and a +1 flamebow two elementally-bound magic weapons that deal extra cold or fire damage when she hits with them (included in the attacks). Meira wears a crimson {@item cloak of protection} and her mithral half plate allows her to roll Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks without disadvantage. She has also imbibed three potions, each giving her resistance to one type of damage, and carries two potions of superior healing for use in emergencies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Meira makes three attacks with the magic weapon she has drawn. She may forgo one weapon attack to drink a potion.

action.name: +1 Frostaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: +1 Flamebow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Potion of Superior Healing (Consumable Item; Carries 2)
entries: Meira drinks the potion and regains 28 ({@dice 8d4 + 8}) hit points.

bonus.name: Shifting (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Meira gains 18 temporary hit points and shifts into a more bestial aspect for 1 minute or until she dies. While shifting, Meira has advantage on Wisdom checks, and attack rolls against her made by creatures within 30 feet of her cannot have advantage, unless she's {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Action Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: Kaine takes an extra action on his turn.

trait.name: Driven (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Kaine rerolls a failed ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with advantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Kaine fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Kaine wields a {@item rapier of wounding} and a +2 hand crossbow and wears a crimson {@item cloak of protection}. He has also imbibed three potions, each giving him resistance to one type of damage, and carries two potions of superior healing for use in emergencies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kaine makes four attacks with his Rapier of Wounding. He may forgo one weapon attack to drink a potion.

action.name: Rapier of Wounding
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a magical wound. Each time Kaine hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: +2 Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Potion of Superior Healing (Consumable Item; Carries 2)
entries: Kaine drinks the potion and regains 28 ({@dice 8d4 + 8}) hit points.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Redcloak takes an extra action on its turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the Redcloak fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Military Tactics
entries: The Redcloak has advantage on attack rolls while it can see an allied creature with 30 feet of it that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Redcloak wields +1 magic weapons and wears a crimson {@item cloak of protection}. It has also imbibed three potions, each giving it resistance to one type of damage, and carries two potions of greater healing for use in emergencies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Redcloak makes three attacks with the weapon it has drawn. The Redcloak may forgo one weapon attack to drink a potion.

action.name: +1 Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: +1 Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Potion of Greater Healing (Consumable Item; Carries 2)
entries: The Redcloak drinks the potion and regains 14 ({@dice 4d4 + 4}) hit points.

resist.special: damage from spells plus any three damage types

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The magebreaker casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):

2e: {@spell dispel magic} (the spellcasting ability check is made with advantage)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the magebreaker fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magebreaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The magebreaker wields a +1 wand of the war mage and wears a crimson {@item cloak of protection}. It has also imbibed three potions, each giving it resistance to one type of damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The magebreaker makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) damage of a type chosen by the magebreaker: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

bonus.name: Healing Light (2nd-Level Spell; 3/Day)
entries: The magebreaker or one creature of its choice within 60 feet of it regains 13 ({@dice 2d8 + 4}) hit points.

reaction.name: Counterspell (4th-Level Spell; 3/Day)
entries: The magebreaker targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it that is casting a spell. The magebreaker makes an Intelligence check with advantage against a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the target's spell fails and has no effect.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Halak has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: Halak can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than him.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When Halak rolls a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Talentan Warrior
entries: Halak uses his Dexterity modifier when making attack and damage rolls with a tangat or sharrash, increases the damage die for a tangat or sharrash to a {@dice d10} when he wields one, increases the range of a Talenta boomerang to 60/100 when he throws one, and boomerangs he throws always return at the end of his turn whether he hits or misses. Halas always catches a returning boomerang if he has a hand free.

trait.name: Vicious
entries: At the start of his turn, Halak can gain advantage on—and deals an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage with—all melee weapon attacks he makes until the start of his next turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Halak makes two melee or ranged weapon attacks.

action.name: Tangat
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talenta Boomerang
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, ranged 60/100 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Halak carries two boomerangs.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Halak halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. Halak must be able to see the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Cavallah casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Cavallah is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Cavallah's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Cavallah regains 15 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Cavallah deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of hers that isn't incapacitated and she doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Cavallah wears +2 chain mail.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cavallah makes two ranged or melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage in Small or Medium form.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage in Small or Medium form.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: Cavallah magically transforms into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into her true form. Other than her size, her statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is her armor, glaive, and bow, which shrink so that they can be worn and wielded in humanoid form. If she dies, Cavallah reverts to her true form, and her weapons revert to their normal size.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see Harash's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of him, Harash can force it to make {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if he isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified}. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

Unless {@status surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Harash until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Harash in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If Harash sees himself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of himself and in an area of bright light, Harash is affected by his own gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Harash makes either three melee attacks—one with his snake hair and two with his shortsword—or two ranged attacks with his longbow.

action.name: Snake Hair
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Keen Eye
entries: Keshta has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight and gains a +5 bonus to his passive {@skill Perception} score (included).

trait.name: Mighty Pull
entries: Keshta may add his Strength modifier as a bonus to damage rolls with longbows (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on Keshta's ranged weapon attack rolls, and his ranged weapon attacks rolls ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Keshta makes two attacks with his longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cazha uses Terrorizing Screech then makes either four claw attacks or three attacks with her greatsword or longbow.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Terrorizing Screech
entries: The Cazha emits an ear-splitting screech in a 120-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature fails a saving throw against Cazha's Terrorizing Screech while already {@condition frightened}, it becomes {@condition paralyzed} as well. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Cazha's Terrorizing Screech for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Luring Song
entries: Cazha sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of her that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. Cazha must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Cazha is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by Cazha, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from Cazha, the target can take the Dash action on its turn to move toward her by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than Cazha, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to Cazha's song for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Slayer's Eye
entries: Cazha rolls a {@dice d10} and adds the result to her next attack or damage roll with a greatsword or longbow before the end of her turn.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If Torarg moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: Torarg can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of his turn, Torarg can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Torarg makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) slashing damage, or 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage while raging.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, or 17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage while raging.

bonus.name: Rage (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Torarg enters a state of rage for 1 minute. While raging, he has resistance to all damage except psychic damage, and deals an extra 4 damage on all melee weapon attacks. Torarg's rage ends early if he is {@condition incapacitated} or affected by a {@spell calm emotions} spell.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit (with disadvantage against a target within 5 ft.), reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage, or 11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage while mounted.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bladesinger casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}; {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bladesinger makes two rapier attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

action.name: Spell Blast (3/Day)
entries: The bladesinger creates a magical blast of energy that can be directed and shaped as the bladesinger desires, choosing between a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 120 feet of it, a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide extending from it in a direction it chooses, or a 40-foot cone. Each creature in the blast must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 31 ({@damage 7d8}) damage of a type chosen by the bladesinger: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

bonus.name: Bladesong (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The bladesinger begins performing the Bladesong. The Bladesong lasts for up to 1 minute, and ends if the bladesinger is {@condition incapacitated}.

While the Bladesong is active, the bladesinger's Armor Class includes its Intelligence bonus, its speed increases by 10 feet, and it applies its Intelligence bonus to Constitution saving throws (noted above).

In the world of Eberron, the Bladesong was not only developed by elves, but by the knightly wizards of Aundair as well—created eight centuries ago separately from any other tradition. The secrets of the Bladesong have since spread to other countries, but it remains an iconic practice of Aundair’s Knights Arcane.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}; {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight either makes two weapon attacks, or makes one weapon attack and casts a cantrip (in any order).

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands, and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell the knight casts before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit (the attack roll is made with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

Eldritch knights are soldiers first and spellcasters second, using their magical aptitude to supplement their mighty martial prowess. These puissant warriors make up the majority of the Order of the Knights Arcane.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}; {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight either makes two weapon attacks, or makes one weapon attack and casts a spell (in any order).

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage if the knight is incorporeal. The target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell the knight casts before the end of its next turn

action.name: Phantom Rider (1/Day)
entries: The knight casts {@spell phantom steed} as an action. When it does, the spell gains the following additional benefits:

items: the spell's duration increases to 4 hours
the steed ignores difficult terrain and can move across liquid surfaces as though affected by the {@spell water walk} spell

bonus.name: Phantom Form (2/Day)
entries: The knight transforms into an incorporeal version of itself for 1 minute. While incorporeal, the knight's weapon attacks deal an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage (noted in the attack), the knight gains a flying speed of 20 feet, and it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The knight takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Within the Order of Knights Arcane, the Knights Phantom are the elite among the elite. These famed eldritch knight-dragoons ride into battle mounted on their namesake—phantom steeds augmented by secret arcane rituals of the order. Aundair credits the Knights Phantom—who fielded arcane cavalry units a dozen strong—with near single-handedly delivering victory after victory during the Last War.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rider casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}; {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Mounted Flyby
entries: When controlling a mounted dragonhawk, the rider doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when its mount flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Quickened Cantrip (3/Day)
entries: The rider uses Spellcasting to cast a cantrip.

The dragonhawk is a symbol of Aundair’s majesty and pride, representing the nation on the royal crest. These gigantic birds of prey are difficult to rear, but the crown invests in several flights trained to carry soldiers into battle. The dragonhawk riders are an esteemed position, often only granted to knights that hold noble titles as a mark of prestige.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Royal Eye casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Royal Eye deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of one of the Royal Eye's allies that isn't incapacitated and the Royal Eye doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Subtle Spell (3/Day)
entries: When the Royal Eye casts a spell, it may do so without any somatic or verbal components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Royal Eye makes two dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The Royal Eye takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Illusory Escape
entries: When the Royal Eye is attacked, it may use Spellcasting to cast {@spell invisibility} before the attack occurs, potentially causing the attack to miss.

Reporting directly to Queen Aurala, the Royal Eyes of Aundair are the nation’s intelligence agency. This network of spies and agents relies on magic—especially divinations, enchantments, and illusions—to succeed in their mission: gathering information to keep Aundair safe. With the signing of the Treaty of Thronehold, the Royal Eyes have adroitly transitioned from wartime efforts of strategic intelligence and sabotage to the current climate of political intrigue and espionage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Aurala casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Royal Inspiration
entries: When Aurala or a creature within 60 feet of her that can see or hear her makes an attack roll, ability check, saving throw, or damage roll, Aurala may roll {@dice 3d6} and add the result to the roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Aurala wears a royal gown, a magic item that grants her an Armor Class equal to 13 + her Dexterity modifier, as well as a crown of protection, which grants her a +2 bonus to AC and all saving throws. If worst comes to worst, Aurala has a +1 dagger and a +2 longbow with which to defend herself.

action.name: +1 Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage

action.name: +2 Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Cutting Wit
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of Aurala makes an attack roll or ability check, Aurala can use her reaction to roll {@dice 3d6} and subtract the result from the creature's roll. This must be done before the results of the roll are determined.

The current monarch of Aundair, Queen Aurala is an insightful and cunning woman. Although Queen Aurala is not a talented mage, nor extraordinarily skilled with arms and armor, her true power lies in her diplomatic skill and ability to expertly navigate the political intrigues of nations and thrones.

Through the Royal Eyes of Aundair, her personal intelligence agency, Queen Aurala is aware of most schemes and motivations within her court. With a benevolent smile or a cutting remark, she plays her nobles to her own advantage and pits rivals against each other— often times, including her two Warlords.

Queen Aurala’s greatest disappointment is most likely the Treaty of Thronehold. Aundair suffered more loss of territory than any country—except, of course, Cyre. With the succession of the Eldeen Reaches, and Thrane’s conquering of Thaliost, Aundair came out of the Last War much diminished. The Treaty upheld these loses, drawing the current political borders of the Five Nations, and Aurala cannot help but sting at the “finalization” of her nation’s defeats in these arenas.

But the Queen of Aundair despairs for not just the lost glory of her own kingdom, but that of the unified Kingdom of Galifar as well. In her heart of hearts, Aurala believes that the Kingdom of Galifar must be reestablished for the good of all the peoples of Khorvaire—and that she is the only ruler worthy of sitting upon the throne of Galifar once again. In her eyes, King Boranel of Breland cares so little for his people that he lets crime and corruption run rampant in his nation. The ir’Wynarns of Thrane have been reduced to figureheads while a cult of zealous fanatics runs the country. King Kaius III of Karrnath is a brutal tyrant that has stripped his people of their rights, once protected by the Code of Galifar. And poor Prince Oragev of Cyre-That-Was no longer has any relevance. Meanwhile, with Aurala’s guiding hand, the people of Aundair enjoy freedom, education, prosperity, and the magical advancements of the Arcane Congress that protect and comfort them. Truly, Khorvaire would enter a new golden age if Aurala’s rule of Aundair spread to all of the Thronehold nations.

Aurala is no blind idealist, however. With her shrewd political acumen, she is not fooled by the current “peace” of the Treaty. She knows that the Last War has not truly ended, merely transitioned to a new cold war, rife with intrigue and sabotage. So, despite her ultimate desire for the peace and prosperity of all of Khorvaire, Aurala makes preparations for renewed hostilities, training and recruiting mages, soldiers, and spies. The Queen of Aundair is determined that when the Last War’s outright hostilities resume, her nation will not only be ready—but victorious.
description: The Royal Inspiration trait makes even a relatively weak combatant a force to be reckoned with. A king or queen’s retainers and guards are willing to fight until the very end to defend them.

Because the Royal Inspiration trait grants the royal NPC’s allies, on average, a +10 bonus on attacks, saving throws, and damage rolls, increase a creature’s challenge rating by 3 steps when designing a balanced encounter if they are an ally of the royal NPC, treating fractional increases as one step.
For example, a simple Guard (Monster Manual) normally has a challenge rating of 1/8, but as the royal NPC’s ally, for the purposes of encounter balance, it has a challenge rating of 1.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Adal casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}; {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Driven (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Rapier

bonus.name: Bladesong {@recharge 5}

While the Bladesong is active, Adal's Armor Class includes his Intelligence bonus, his speed increases by 10 feet, and he applies his Intelligence bonus to Constitution saving throws (noted above).

bonus.name: Dimension Step (2nd-level Spell; 3/Day)
entries: Adal and all equipment he is wearing or carrying teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet of him.

Queen Aurala’s brother, Lord Adal ir’Wynarn, serves as Aundair’s First Warlord and Minister of Magic. He shares many of his sister’s ideals, preparing for the next war and ensuring Aundair emerges victorious from it, with Aundair’s ruler at the head of a new united Galifar. However, he sees himself as that ruling monarch, believing he is the true power behind Aundair’s throne, with only an accident of birth keeping himself from being King.

Though he has not yet formulated any plans to oust his sister, Adal ir’Wynarn has not been idle. His immediate goal is to reclaim Thaliost, ideally in the opening moments of renewed hostility. To that effect, he and a cabal of amoral wizards under his supervision are researching devastating war magic. Adal hopes to create a single arcane event capable of eradicating an entire army or city in but a moment. With this hypothetical spell—referred to in his notes as apocalypse from the sky—he will decimate Thrane’s forces around Thaliost, and cow the rest of the Thronehold nations into surrender.

bonus.name: Phantom Form {@recharge 5}

While incorporeal, Darro's weapon attacks deal an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage (noted in the attack), he gains a flying speed of 20 feet, and he can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Darro takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

Second Warlord of the Realm and Lord of the Knights Arcane, Darro ir’Lain is a former Knight Phantom—and was one of their most deadly warriors. His current strategic focus is in planning a campaign to reclaim the western lands that succeeded from Aundair during the Last War to form the Eldeen Reaches. Lord Darro possesses immense influence in Aundair’s affairs, second only to Queen Aurala herself and her brother, but he is a military man first and foremost, taking pride in his station as one of his queen’s foremost military strategists.

To do so, he must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon with finesse in one hand, and nothing in his other hand. After the attack is resolved, whether it hits or misses, Jurian immediately makes a melee weapon attack against the creature that attacked him if it is within his reach.

Queen Aurala’s second son, Prince Jurian is estranged from his mother’s good graces. In self-exile from Aundair to avoid the consequences of winning a duel to the death against one of his mother’s noble lords—in which he defended the honor of an acquaintance—the rakish scoundrel of a prince currently survives on the good graces of his peers and admirers in Breland.

Far away from Fairhaven, the capital of Aundair, the aging Raulo ir’Trannick serves as the Lord Mayor of Arcanix, governing the village over which the floating towers of the Arcane Congress drift. Raulo is among the committee of wizards that preside over the yearly entrance exams for the admission to the Arcane Congress’s institute of higher learning. The undisputed head of the Dark Dagger gang, Kreelo is the most wanted criminal in Fairhaven. While he doesn’t control all crime in Aundair’s capital, Kreelo has a stranglehold on several merchants, extorting them to help the Dark Daggers smuggle dangerous and illicit contraband into Fairhaven. While he was more daring in his youth, Kreelo now holes up in his gang’s headquarters—a dilapidated, abandoned cathedral to the Silver Flame from which he runs his criminal empire.
